it.uniroma1.lcl.mynn

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma1.lcl.mynn.Layer

  • public class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a layer from the neural network scheme. A layer object keep inside a set of neurons of the same family. Through its methods is able to activate all the neurons and store the processed output in order to give it to another layer.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nunzio Castelli

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Layer(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String activationFunction)
      Create a layer object able to keep inside a set of neurons of the same family.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layer

        public Layer(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String activationFunction)
        Create a layer object able to keep inside a set of neurons of the same family. This means that all the neurons will use the same activation function and they will have the same number of inputs connections.
        Parameters:
        name - layer name.
        activationFunction - name of the function used by the neurons.

    • Method Detail

      • getActivationFunction

        public java.lang.String getActivationFunction()
        Returns the name of the activation function used by the current object layer.
        Returns:
        activation function name.

      • setActivationFunction

        public void setActivationFunction(java.lang.String activationFunction)
        Set the activation function name. The previously value will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        activationFunction - name of the function used by neurons.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the current object layer object.
        Returns:
        object layer name.

      • getNeuronInputUnits

        public int getNeuronInputUnits()
        Returns the number of connection inputs for the neurons.
        Returns:
        number of expected inputs or zero if no neurons are kept by the current object layer.

      • getNeuronInputUnits_j7

        public int getNeuronInputUnits_j7()

      • getWeightsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[]> getWeightsList()
        Returns the weights of all neurons mantained by the current object layer.
        Returns:
        list of array, each element of the list is an array with all the weights of one neuron.

      • getWeightsList_j7

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[]> getWeightsList_j7()

      • getOutputUnits

        public int getOutputUnits()
        Returns the number of neurons mantained by the current object layer.
        Returns:
        number of neurons inside the layer.

      • getProcessedLayer

        public double[] getProcessedLayer()
        Return the processed output, in according with the activation function, of the current object layer.
        Returns:
        array of data representing the processed output of all the neurons.

      • getLayerInputs

        public double[] getLayerInputs()

      • setLayerNeuronOutput

        public void setLayerNeuronOutput(int i,
                                 double output)
        Store the value representing the output of an neuron at the specified position. The previously value, if exists, will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        i - position element where the value will be stored.
        output - value representing the neuron output.

      • setLayerNeuronOutput

        public void setLayerNeuronOutput(Neuron neuron,
                                 double output)
                          throws ActivateFunctionException
        Store the value representing the output of an neuron at the specified position. The previously value, if exists, will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        neuron - that has generated the output.
        output - value representing the neuron output.
        Throws:
        ActivateFunctionException

      • setLayerInputs

        public void setLayerInputs(double[] inputs)

      • activateNeuron

        public double activateNeuron(int i,
                             double[] values)
                      throws ActivateFunctionException
        Activate a neuron from the current object layer. The activation function invoked will the depend from the activation function name stored into the layer. The invokation is dinamically resolved with reflection strategy, on errors an exception will be raised.
        Parameters:
        i - neuron index to activate.
        values - inputs of the neuron.
        Returns:
        neuron output value.
        Throws:
        ActivateFunctionException
        See Also:
        class for error management.

      • activateNeuron

        public double activateNeuron(Neuron neuron,
                             double[] values)
                      throws ActivateFunctionException
        Activate a neuron from the current object layer. The activation function invoked will the depend from the activation function name stored into the layer. The invokation is dinamically resolved with reflection strategy, on errors an exception will be raised.
        Parameters:
        neuron - to activate.
        values - inputs of the neuron.
        Returns:
        neuron output value.
        Throws:
        ActivateFunctionException
        See Also:
        class for error management.

      • activateNeuronF1

        public double activateNeuronF1(int i,
                               double[] values)
                        throws ActivateFunctionException
        Activate a neuron from the current object layer. The activation function invoked will be the derivate F1 related to the activation function name stored into the layer. The invokation is dinamically resolved with reflection strategy, on errors an exception will be raised.
        Parameters:
        i - neuron index to activate.
        values - inputs of the neuron.
        Returns:
        neuron output value.
        Throws:
        ActivateFunctionException
        See Also:
        class for error management.
